title: Rebekah Vardy returns to Instagram amid Coleen Rooney row
text:
Rebekah Vardy shared a sweet birthday message to daughter Sofia (Picture: Getty)

Rebekah Vardy has shared a sweet birthday message to daughter Sofia, following her spat with Coleen Rooney.

Taking to Instagram, Jamie Vardy’s wife shared a string of photos to commemorate their oldest child’s fifth birthday.

The first snap showed the 37-year-old cuddling the little one in her hospital bed, just moments after giving birth.

While others showed Sofia at various stages in her life, decked out in princess dresses and glitter face paint.

Yes, we are jealous of a five-year-old’s face paint.

Alongside the photos, she told her 427k followers: ‘Happy 5th Birthday to our Little Princess. We love you so much #familyiseverything.’

Jamie was among the first to comment, posting: [Love] her so much x.’

‘Such a beautiful little girl! Happy birthday,’ another replied.

An Instagram user said: ‘She’s so cute have a lovely birthday.’

Advertisement

While one fan couldn’t resist making a little dig about her row with Coleen, adding: ‘It’s ……….. Rebekah Vardy.’

That meme isn’t going anywhere soon…

Their comment comes after Rebekah and Coleen found themselves in the mother of all feuds, earlier this month.

Rebekah and Jamie Vardy are expecting their fourth child together (Picture: Getty)

It all kicked off when Wayne Rooney’s wife accused the I’m A Celebrity star of selling stories about her to the press in a lengthy Instagram statement – something she has furiously denied.

‘For a few years now someone I trusted to follow me on my personal Instagram account has been consistently informing The Sun newspaper of my private posts and stories,’ the 33-year-old began.

‘There has been so much information given to them about me, my friends and my family – all without my permission or knowledge. After a long time of trying to figure out who it could be, for various reasons, I had a suspicion.

‘To try and prove this, I came up with an idea. I blocked everyone from viewing my Instagram stories except ONE account. (Those on my private account must have been wondering why I haven’t had stories on there for a while.)

‘Over the past five months I have posted a series of false stories if they made their way into the Sun newspaper. And you know what, they did! The story about gender selection in Mexico, the story about returning to TV and then the latest story about the basement flooding in my new house.

Coleen Rooney claimed Rebekah had been leaking stories about her (Picture: Getty)

‘It’s been tough keeping it to myself and not making any comment at all, especially when the stories have been leaked, however I had to. Now I know for certain which account/individual it’s come from.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I have saved and screenshotted all the original stories which clearly show just one person has viewed them. It’s…… Rebekah Vardy’s account.’

Fans couldn’t cope with the drama, with memes taking over social media and #WAGathaChristie trending on Twitter.

Jamie was also mocked on his return to the football pitch over the weekend, in Leicester’s game against Burnley.

Rebekah, who is pregnant with her fifth child, swiftly denied all claims, sharing her own statement on Instagram.

‘As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this. I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me over the years can vouch for,’ she said.

‘If you thought this was happening you could have told me & I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped. Over the years various people have had access to my Insta and just this week I found I was following people I didn’t know and have never followed myself.

‘I’m not being funny but I don’t need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you? I liked you a lot Coleen and I’m so upset that you have chosen to do this, especially when I’m heavily pregnant.

‘I’m disgusted that I’m even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened.’

So. Much. Drama.
